WRITING.TEXT: If you need to talk to someone, it's not a bad thing. Everyone does, and I'm sure at least some of them would understand if you need to just talk things out. If they aren't giving you the time you need, though, then you need to make it clear that you have needs like this, like everyone else. And of they don't take it seriously, then there's someone else who will

It's not really about "fate" or anything like that. What I mean is, your life is exactly the same as before you learned about determinism. It doesn't matter in the end whether we control our actions or not, because the world we live in is the same one as it was yesterday

I beleive in determinism, but i think of it a little differently than just you have no control. Basically, if determinism is true, it still doesn't mean that there's a set future or that the future you think you're destined for is what you'll get. What I mean is, even if there is no free will, we still don't know what the future is. We still feel the effects of our actions and those effects can be good and bad. There's no reason to be afraid of a lack of free will, because its out of our hands whether there is or isnt.

You just need to explain to her that too much advice and help stresses you out, and that you'll help yourself more when your ready.
She might also be putting this on you if she's going through a tough time too to kind of forget about her own stuff going on. Does she talk about what's going on with her a lot?

A covalent bond is when 2 or more orbitals overlap, but electrons tend to stay in the orbitals of carbon slightly more because they are at a lower energy state in the carbon orbital which is more stable. This means carbon has a slightly negative average charge
Fallout New Vegas

In organic chemistry, reduction is when you gain something that increases charge density with the carbons, so when you ad a hydrogen, with a lower electronegativity than carbon, the carbon gets slightly more electron dense than before. Oxidation in organic chemistry reduces carbon's charge density, like oxygen or chlorine
It shouldn't ruin your friendship with either of them. This could be a really good thong honestly.
I'm sorry, I'm not sure what you need help with? Is this necessarily a bad thing?

Don't do that, I know it's hard to keep going, but cutting your life short isn't the answer. If your parent's really don't like you, that isn't your fault, it's not a reflection of you in any way. If your friends don't like you, then that's their loss, not yours. Scree them, there are people out there who will care about you and love you, even if people around you right now don't give you what you need. Happiness is hard, but over time, we make it. Don't give up

My friend went through something similar. His girlfriend cheated on hin at 16 and told him the baby was his, he didn't know he was cheated on. He found out after it was born and thought it was his for i think a few months, left her and hasn't spoken to her since. He doing much much better now because he "got out of there"
She betrayed you, you don't owe her anything. Take care of yourself so you can save your energy and life for someone who appreciates you.
Of course, we're here to help, whenever you need it. I hope you feel better soon.

None of us are born with rational thoughts, we have emotions and desires getting in the way. Some of us just get depression to add to it.
I know those thoughts, honestly I do. Don't listen to them. It won't make things better, its just a flaw in our biology that we sometimes think that way.
I'm sorry if none of this is making you feel any better. We all know what it's like to have people tell us to stay strong or something when we're down. I don't blame you if you don't wanna read any of this, but if there's one thing you should listen to out of any of our comments, its that you shouldn't go through with your plan.

The thoughts going through your head about this aren't thoughts you should listen to. Depression sucks, it makes you want to die, and you'll think of ways to justify that, but it can't be justified because there's no logic or reason behind them.
Don't listen to those thoughts, they aren't worth it. Who cares if you moved back home? We all hit a shitstorm at least a couple times in our lives, it's nothing to be ashamed about.
If your deoression isn't getting better, you need to talk to someone about it, your doctor or a counselor, and if you've told your friends explicitly and they still don't understand, then either sit them down and make it clear or find people that do care.
You are worth being alive, you aren't a failure and you are good enough for a career and a relationship. Sure there's a couple things you need to fix but we're all a little screwed up. Nothing wrong with being human. Don't give up, not because you owe it to anyone, but because these thoughts aren't yours, the "decision" to kill yourself isn't yours. It isn't worth all the pain it will cause, and it isn't going to make anything better for you or anyone.
If you don't take care of yourself too, you won't be able to help them for too long. They won't mind either, they would prefer you take care of yourself more
Ya my friends don't know alot about my depression, just that I have it. If you really aren't doing well, you might wanna tell them though.

I think I understand what you mean. I can't imagine life without depression, I'm just so used to it that sometimes I wanna make myself as depressed as I used to be. It makes no sense but I don't want it to leave

I understand. People who don't have any sort of personal experience with it sometimes have a hard time understanding it. There are people everywhere with depression though, dont worry, you aren't alone irl. It can be hard to find friends who have dealt with it too, because alot of people who go through it are sort of less sociable, or try to put on a brave face for every one to see.
No problem! You never alone as long as you have reddit lol
Always been every month for me. I think you can change it in the settings on the opening screen
Didn't you play the battlefront games? They turn frickin invisible

Studies usually helped me take my mind of things which almost nothing else does in my daily life. It was easier for me to focus on things I understood and could learn more about than the things that made me sad, so ya it helped me. Hope it helps you too!

I'm going to school for chemistry, and right now, it's one of my only priorities. I've always liked science, but going to school to be a scientist is different than just thinking about being a scientist. I can see myself improving in the field, and I've started working at a research lab on campus. It's wicked exciting.
Alot of what you said sounds like something I would say, especially about family, I feel like a shitty son. Once you find something you love to do, something that makes you want to get up every morning, you will put yourself into it like you've never thought you could. Keep trying to find your purpose dude, and don't let people like your landlady keep you down. Screw psychopaths and sociopaths.
I'm sorry. I know it's hard. There's no good reason for pain to be in our lives, but it is.
Can I ask what you can't bear?

I'm so sorry. I can't imagine what its like to lose a home like that or have your family in danger like that. I don't know what kind of person just gets up and leaves like that, too. He's scum if he can't help you and your family in a hard time.
All I can really say is, things could have gone much worse, and they didn't. Not that they went well either. If you can take it day by day and you and your family can move past this, you'll all be stronger for it.
Sorry if this wasn't any help or if it made you feel worse.

We all get down sometimes, just gotta pick ourselves back up. You sound like you're not doing that bad though, living in New york isn't easy after all. I mean, debt isn't fun at all, obviously, but most people have debt I think. You can get through this, don't worry

If you kill yourself, what are you going to put your friends and family through? Especially if you do it while you're hanging out with them, they'll blame themselves. If you die tomorrow, you'll be gone, but they will have to live with it. There's a good chance they'll get depressed, too.
I know what its like to want to kill yourself. It sucks. This world sucks. But is it really worth devastating your friends? I promise you people care more than you know.

Of course you deserve help, you didn't choose to be depressed or anxious. I guess I don't really have to tell you not to kill yourself because it would be hell to your family and friends, since you already said that, but it's still true. All I can really say is that those thoughts aren't worth listening to. The world isn't going to get better if you leave, and you won't be happier if you die, you'll just be gone.
I don't know how to fix depression or anxiety, but I do know suicidal thoughts aren't logical thoughts, they have no reason behind them, they just sorta pop into existance if you have depression. Your friends and family are real, they're a logical reason to not commit suicide. I understand if this wasn't very helpful, but I hope you feel better soon.
By the way, I wouldn't really worry about not being productive too much, honestly our whole species is barely productive at all.

Don't worry, we all feel like this at least sometimes. I understand what you mean exactly, life just seems tedious at some point, like there isn't a reason to keep going but we just do, cuz its easiest to just go with the flow. Or maybe it's different for you.

I think it would be a good idea to talk to your doctor about this. There's nothing wrong with you, but if you think you should get help, don't hesitate to talk to someone. Take care of yourself buddy, sorry.
I'm sorry to hear that. If your medicine isn't helping that much, you should let your doctor know. I don't really have a lot of advice, don't have all this figured out for myself, sorry.

I think doctors say depression is sadness that lasts for more than 6 months. I've heard that it can be genetic or caused by an event. Probably more causes too. Sounds like you came to the right place. Sorry buddy

Antidepressants are definitely one of the most annoying medicines out there, but medical research has shown they can help. I hope you feel better soon!

I think alcohol might be the biggest problem right now for you. It's incredibly addictive, and it's medically considered a depressant, it reduces what your nerves can do while you have it in your system (that includes your brain's neurons). You should also maybe find another psychologist to see if the one you have right now isn't enough for you. I'm glad you're still able to not be a shitbag and cheat on your girlfriend though, thats definitely a plus to your charecter, alot of people would do whatever they want and not care about how it affects others close to them.

I'm sorry, I didn't mean to make you unhappy. If there's something up with your memory or attention span, talk to your doctor about it? You might not be sleeping well or something. How old are you? Most people have no intellect honestly, don't worry about that, it was just the first thing that came to my mind. Alot of people I know and alot of people I know of say they aren't good at anything, so that isn't abnormal. Don't worry about how good other people's lives are, there's always someone who's happier or better off, no matter how much they don't deserve it. I'm not trying to tell you how to live, I just mean that there are alot of people who have gone through what you are, and who feel the way you do. Your problems won't go away over night, and sonetines they feel unbearable, but don't give up hope. Things will get better

Bullies are assholes. They have no good reason to act the way they do. I'm not gonna tell to just let it roll off your shoulders, I'm sure you've heard that a thousand times, and it definitely isn't easy. What they think doesn't matter, though, because, honestly, they don't end up with happy lives most if the time. They surround thenselves eith other assholes and they become less and less important to everyone else over time. Also, you don't have to loce yourself right away. Healing takes time and effort. Take it day by day, find people who aren't assholes to talk to, build up your abilities, like get great at math, or science, or anything that will help you. You don't beed to be perfect, because no one is. Just cut yourself some slack from time to time, and remember, you are as deserving of happiness as everyone else.

You're aren't shit. You're a person going through a tough time. Don't lose hope, this will pass. Believe in yourself. You can get through this. You don't have to be perfect, that's impossible. Just try to be happy with who you are and don't blame yourself for this.
No problem dude. Anytime you need to talk, we're here :)

I know that artillery van engage from the vack row, so having a full bavk line of artillery is optimal. Cavalry's advantage gets smaller and smaller as the game progresses, so I know there is less need for them, but I don't think they're ever completely useless. There isn't much point in putting in too much cav tho, because it gets harder for them to take on infantry on their own, and sinse they're always on the flanks, having too many units will force your farthest cav units to only recieve support from other cav units and artillery, which isnt good, because combat switches from shock to fire over and over again, and cavalry have horrible fire compared to infantry

I hate taking my pills. It's so annoying to take it every day just so I feel the same. But scientific research is trustworthy, and it says antidepressants can work. It might take a few different tries, it might only imporve your mood slightly, or it might only make you slightly more stable. But the evidence is clear, it does help. Wish you the best, stay safe

I'm sorry for your spouse and you, that sucks. The chance of something like that is small, but it does happen. Don't worry too much about it happening to your parents, its still unlikely, even if it happened to someone you know. It might've just hit you really hard, when people have to face their or a loved one's mortality, we usually freak out for a little while. I think you should just try to enjoy the time you have with the people you love, if you worry all the time theres no time left to be happy with them.

That's terrible! Dont worry about "ruining his life," hes honestly probably a psychopath or something. Im a freshman in college, and i think i know what you mean. Im majoring in chemistry, and its pretty hard. Alotta of people have switch out of the major in just the first semester, but it doesnt seem like a big deal, actually. Not that you should be too laid back about this, just that its unrealistic to know exactly what you want to do for a living by 18. Some of my friends work full time jobs, some are going to college. Theyre all doing pretty ok at least, so as far as i can tell, you only need to be thinking about where you might want to be in the future, and taking steps to start getting out there. Don't stress it too much, but don't take it lightly either, if that makes any sense. Hope this helped
Im sorry. Feelimg tired all the time sucks, especially when you cant figure out how to stop it. I hope you feel better soon
No problem :)

Every time I've talked to a therapist or counselor, I've been anxious about what to say becasue i was afraid of them being dissapointed. I think this is just an anxiety thing though, I dont think they actually judge their patients. Talking about whats on your mind is good, and I hope it does help you alot. One thing I know is that staying in bed only makes you feel less bad, it doesn't make you feel better because it doesn't solve anything you miggt be dealing with. I hope you feel better soon

I don't do it every night before bed, and I don't pray to a god, but I constantly just want to not have to live anymore. I think this is common in depressed people, but not in others. I'm sorry that you've felt that way for so long

I am so sorry. I can't believe nobody answered you, i just read your last post. That sucks, bad. I live in MA where people mostly dont care about weed, and it did help for a while, but I get paranoid all the time now. I know that church isnt going to help, unless you'd want to become a priest or nun, or something, which isn't the life most people want. Your case sounds more complicated than mine, so I might not be much help. If therapists and counselors haven't helped, honestly Im not sure what else to do. I'm sorry. The only thing I can think is to find friends who you love and love you back. I got lucky, but it isnt easy for everyone. It takes alot, and you have to find people who won't take advantage of you and will give back what you give to them. Im sorry if this isnt helpful. I hioe you feel better soon. Sorry about the whole weed thing too.

I'm sorry you feel that way. I've dealt with depression since muddle school, and I've felt alot of things since. Sone days it's not too bad, others, it just sucks. Life can feel hopeless or pointless, but I think you should keep going. If you have a doctor, it might be a good idea to talk to them in private about this. Depression is a really complicated issue, many people deal with it, and there isn't a perfect answer yet. But they can help at least. Plus, with the recommendation of a doctor, your parents might be more sympathetic to what you're feeling. I don't suggest going to teachers because, at least in the US, they can't really do much and sometimes, legal protocol just makes the situation more complicated. Again, I hope you keep going and don't try to hurt yourself or anything, but don't feel guilty gor what you're feeling. This sub is also a good place for talking if you're feeling really down. GOOD LUCK!! I mean it :)

This honestly feels so relatable to me. It feels so shitty sometimes. Hope you feel better
